frame.name: Dominate_situation
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> acts so as to be the strongest force, or most important causal factor in some <fen>Situation</fen>, to the exclusion of other competing actors.
<ex><fex name="Agent">York</fex> <t>dominated</t> <fex name="Situation">the game</fex> <fex name="Manner">as they held the ball on offense almost the entire 70 minutes</fex>.</ex> <ex>Is there a future for Unix in <fex name="Situation">a market</fex> <fex name="Degree">increasingly</fex> <t>dominated</t> <fex name="Agent">by Microsoft</fex>?</ex> <ex><fex name="Agent">Walz</fex> <t>dominated</t> <fex name="Situation">the debate</fex> <fex name="Degree">so completely it was almost embarrassing</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> is the most forceful and pivotal factor in the situation.</def-root>

FE.name: Situation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Situation</fen> is primarily affected by the <fen>Agent</fen>, in particular how it develops or concludes.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> is dominant.
<ex>As discussed above, Ford <t>dominated</t> the market <fex name="tim">in the 1920s</fex>, then left the business to create production capacity for the Model A.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition:
<def-root>The period of time over which the domination occurs.
<ex>Dinosaurs were vertebrate animals that <t>dominated</t> the terrestrial ecosystem <fex name="dur">for over 160 million years</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location where the domination takes place.
<ex>Indeed, <fex name="pla">in all Latin America</fex>, United States corporations <t>dominated</t> the key sectors of the economy.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>A description of the event as a whole, or of any of the participants that does not fit any of the other more specific Frame Elements.
<ex>Most predict that the top teams from last year to <fex name="man">ruthlessly</fex> <t>dominate</t> the league.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: dominate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: have a commanding or controlling influence over.

lexUnit.name: domination.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a state of controlling force over a situation.

lexUnit.name: dominant.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: most important, powerful, or influential.

lexUnit.name: predominate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be the strongest or main element.

lexUnit.name: rule.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: having significant influence over a situation
